alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued September 01 at 11:25PM MST until September 02 at 12:30AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... * Until 1230 AM MST. * At 1124 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from Litchfield Park to near Luke AFB to near Perryville to Liberty, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 93 and 130. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 144 and 154. AZ Route 303 between mile markers 105 and 114. Locations impacted include... Surprise, Avondale, Goodyear, Buckeye, Tonopah, Litchfield Park, Palo Verde, Perryville, Luke AFB, Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, Wintersburg and Estrella Mountain Ranch. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
